data_snapshot.price_action: Gold (XAUUSD) shows strong bullish momentum with close near daily high (4442.81 vs H:4448.94), breaking above all EMAs and upper Bollinger Band. S&P500 modestly positive, DXY and VIX showing weakness.
data_snapshot.momentum: Gold RSI 78.58 (overbought), MACD bullish (72.65 > SIG 60.42), ADX 30.47 shows strengthening trend. S&P500 neutral momentum (RSI 57.44), DXY and VIX bearish momentum.
data_snapshot.volatility: Gold VOL_REGIME: medium (VOL_PCT: 45.11%), PARK_VOL: 0.0091. S&P500 low volatility (VOL_PCT: 31.39%). VIX low volatility regime despite being fear index.
data_snapshot.cross_assets: DXY weakness (97.92, bearish signals) supporting gold. S&P500 stable (6877.65) with low VIX (16.77) suggests risk-on environment. Inverse correlation: gold strength vs dollar weakness.

analysis.trend: Strong bullish trend for gold with breakout above technical levels, supported by weak dollar and stable equity markets
key_drivers: Low volatility in equities supporting risk-on
analysis.reasoning: Gold demonstrates clear breakout characteristics with price above all moving averages and Bollinger Bands, strong momentum indicators, and supportive cross-asset dynamics (weak DXY, stable SPX, low VIX). The VOL_REGIME medium suggests adequate volatility for continuation, while HURST 0.4362 indicates mean-reverting tendencies that may support pullbacks for entry.
risk_factors: RSI overbought (78.58) may lead to short-term pullback
Gold VOL_PCT 45.11% suggests moderate volatility risk
VIX at low levels (16.77) could spike unexpectedly
ADX 30.47 shows trend strength but not extreme
